vectorData.altText: 5. Identify the layer of skin indicated by the letter A.
That's right! Epidermis is the superficial layer of skin consisting of stratified keratinized squamous epithelium.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.

Skin is a self-renewing organ covering all external surfaces ranging from 1 mm to 4 mm in thickness. It is continuous with mucous membranes     at body openings
Skin consists of TWO layers:
epidermis: stratified squamous keratinized epithelium
a variety of cell types
a laminated structure
thick skin hairless, found on palms of hands & soles 
   of feet; thin skin elsewhere, usually with hair 
dermis: underlying CT consist of two layers:
papillary layer
reticular layer
The subcutaneous layer (a.k.a. hypodermis / superficialfascia (inc. Campers fascia) is separated from skin (C)
Skin appendages / accessory structures of skin:
hair
nails
multicellular exocrine glands, including the mammary glands
Line all INTERNAL body surfaces that open to the exterior of the body; e.g. digestive, respiratory, urogenital tracts

the classification of burns is based on the skin layers involved: a first-degree burn involves the epidermis only; a second-degree burn involves the epidermis and into the deep dermis; a third-degree burn extends through the epidermis, through the thickness of the dermis and may reach into the hypodermis
